title: Ticket #7370: ClassAd.setdefault default argument doesn't work
description:
ClassAd nominally supports the setdefault method of Python mutable mappings (https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict.setdefault). It works as expected when default is given and is not None.

However, when default is not given, or is given as None (which are supposed to be equivalent), we get an error: 

c = classad.ClassAd()
sd = c.setdefault('key')

TypeError: Unable to convert Python object to a ClassAd expression.

The obvious problem is that None doesn't have a ClassAd expression equivalent. If we can decide on one, that should be the default argument. If we can't, then the default argument of this method should be changed to whatever we think is most reasonable (Undefined?).
remarks:
2019-Nov-13 17:00:15 by tlmiller:
The fix actually changes the general from Python to ExprTree routine to handle None as undefined, which may not be sane in the general case.

Also, why didn't anybody ever document classad.Value.undefined and classad.Value.error?

2019-Nov-14 08:08:13 by karpel:
That seems like a reasonable semantic equivalency to me.

I created #7377 for documenting classad.Value
derived_tickets: #7377   Document Python classad.Value enum
check_ins: 2019-Nov-13 16:57   Check-in [58458]: (#7370) Treat 'None' as 'undefined' when converting from Python to ExprTree. (By Todd L Miller )
creator: karpel
